faqs.title: What is DrawPen?
faqs.content: DrawPen is a desktop application that operates locally on your device. It does not replace your presentation software; instead, it provides a simple annotation layer that works on top of any application you are using.

faqs.title: Is DrawPen free to use?
faqs.content: Yes. DrawPen is distributed free of charge and is fully open source under the MIT license.

faqs.title: Which operating systems are supported?
faqs.content: DrawPen is available on macOS, Windows and Linux. Installers can be downloaded from GitHub Releases or installed via supported package managers such as Homebrew or Scoop.

faqs.title: Can I configure keyboard shortcuts?
faqs.content: Yes. The application includes a settings interface where global activation shortcuts and tool-specific keybindings can be customized.

faqs.title: How can I report an issue or request a new feature?
faqs.content: All bug reports and feature requests are managed through GitHub Issues. Open a new issue in the DrawPen repository and include a concise description and, if relevant, reproduction steps.

faqs.title: How do I install DrawPen?
faqs.content: Download your platform’s installer from GitHub Releases. macOS users may install the Homebrew cask, Windows users may use Scoop, and all platforms support manual installation.

faqs.title: How do I show or hide the DrawPen overlay?
faqs.content: Use CMD/CTRL + SHIFT + A to toggle the annotation overlay on or off.

faqs.title: What drawing tools are included?
faqs.content: The application provides Pen, Shapes, Text, Highlighter, Laser and Eraser tools. Each tool can be activated using number-key shortcuts.

faqs.title: How can I adjust stroke color or thickness?
faqs.content: Use the provided controls to switch between available colors and modify the stroke thickness.

faqs.title: How do I clear all drawings on the screen?
faqs.content: Press CMD or CTRL + K to remove all annotations from the overlay.

faqs.title: Does DrawPen include a whiteboard mode?
faqs.content: Yes. Press CMD or CTRL + E to open a blank whiteboard canvas for free-form drawing.

faqs.title: Can DrawPen annotate over any application?
faqs.content: Yes. DrawPen operates using a transparent overlay that appears above all other windows.

faqs.title: How can I save my drawings?
faqs.content: At the moment, annotations can be saved only by using your operating system’s screenshot functionality. Additional export options may be introduced in future versions.

faqs.title: What customization options are available?
faqs.content: Settings allow configuration of shortcuts, color schemes, stroke widths, interface elements, toolbar placement and other drawing preferences.

faqs.title: Which license governs DrawPen?
faqs.content: DrawPen is released under the MIT license.

faqs.title: What should I do if the app behaves unexpectedly?
faqs.content: Review existing GitHub Issues, and if the problem is not already tracked, create a new issue or submit a pull request with a fix.

faqs.title: Why choose DrawPen?
faqs.content: DrawPen is a cross-platform annotation tool designed for presentations, tutorials, coding sessions and technical explanations. It is fully open source, extensible and easy to integrate into any workflow.
